intro: Lepistemon binectarifer, commonly known as the two-flowered lepistemon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in pairs, and typically have a yellowish or greenish hue with prominent stamens. Lepistemon binectarifer is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
